definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: But they are now a fact, " Hague added.
sentences.chinese: 但现在它们已是既成事实，”黑格说。

sentences.english: The settlement of the issue must not be conditional upon the acceptance of fait accompli.
sentences.chinese: 不能在造成既成事实的前提下解决这个问题。

sentences.english: Wall Street eminences are already treating the downgrade as a fait accompli.
sentences.chinese: 在华尔街看来，国债评级下调已是既成事实。

sentences.english: Highly respected scientists have come to a consensus as to the impact of global warming.
sentences.chinese: 顶尖的科学家们已经就温室现象的既成事实达成一致。

definition: lit. the timber has been turned into a boat already (idiom)/fig. what is done cannot be undone
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
not to enjoy popular support/to be unpopular
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
(of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred
pinyin: ming2 bu5 zheng4 yan2 bu5 shun4
